Nobel laureate Wole Soyinka in Washington yester day addressed the world press berating the ruling military junta and likening its leader General Sani Abacha to a burgeoning Idi Amin. Nobel laureate Wole Soyinka in Washington yester day addressed the world press berating the ruling military junta and likening its leader General Sani Abacha to a burgeoning Idi Amin.

Soyinka, who fled Nigeria in mid November to prevent his imminent arrest, said the regime of General Abacha was "nothing but a terrorist organization whose stock in trade is hostage-taking."
